sourceMeaningMnemonic: You <radical>say</radical> things around a <radical>fire</radical>. In fact there are two <radical>fire</radical>s, and you're <kanji>discuss</kanji>ing something that's really important to you with a group of people, all sitting around two nice campfires.
meaningInfo: Imagine yourself next to the two campfires, having a heart-to-heart discussion. What are you saying?
readingMnemonic: You <kanji>discuss</kanji> in this intense, fiery way all the way until <reading>dawn</reading> (<ja>だん</ja>), but no longer! Once dawn comes the discussion needs to be concluded.
readingInfo: If you try to discuss something all night and past dawn, you'll burn out. Take the day, think, then tonight you can try to discuss it again.
